Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • Deck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Card>

    public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Card>
    Represents a deck of playing cards.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Dr. Jody Paul

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DECK_SIZE
      Number of cards in a full deck.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Deck()
      Constructor that yields an ordered deck of cards.

      Deck copy constructor.

        public Deck()
        Constructor that yields an ordered deck of cards.

      • Deck

        public Deck(Deck inDeck)
        Deck copy constructor. Shallow copy: uses the same card references as the original.
        Parameters:
        inDeck - the deck to be copied

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public final int size()
        Returns the number of Cards in this Deck.
        Returns:
        the size of this deck

      • getCard

        public final Card getCard(int which)
        Returns the card at a specified position in this deck.
        Parameters:
        which - the location of the desired card
        Returns:
        the card at the specified location

      • setCard

        public final Card setCard(int which,
                          Card inCard)
        Specifies the card at a given position by exchanging cards. Puts the card currently at that position into the position vacated by the specified card.

        Precondition:
        The specified card must already exist within the deck.

        Parameters:
        which - Location in which to put specified card
        inCard - The specified Card
        Returns:
        The card now at the indicated location

      • iterator

        public final java.util.Iterator<Card> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<Card>

      • deal

        public final Card deal()
        Removes the card from the beginning of the deck.
        Returns:
        the card that was at the beginning of the deck; null if deck contains no cards

      • shuffle

        public final void shuffle()
        Performs a simple shuffle by exchanging cards. Uses java.util.Collections.shuffle()

      • showAll

        public final java.lang.String showAll()
        Returns string representation of every card in this deck and in the order they appear in the deck.
        Returns:
        displayable string for this deck

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Internal unit testing.

        args - ignored
